result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Order for payment of Atty. John Rhiel as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $620.70.

It is hereby ordered that: The Defendant is liable for court appointed attorney fees.  The Defendant shall pay these fees, in full, within 60 days or on a payment plan approved by the bookkeeping department.  Failure to pay attorney fees shall result in entry of a civil judgment.

Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 15CM151, 15CM153, 15CM287, 15CF374, 15CM395 called together at 8:49am [mo]
Defendant McKenzie A Hansen in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Rhiel indicates that a resolution has been met; requests additional time to speak with Ms. Hansen. 
recess: 8:50--reconvene: 9:26am

Appearances Remain the Same

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Case 15CF374 Counts #3, #4, and #5, Case 15CM153 Count #1, and Case 15CM287 Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: 
--All Remaining Counts of Case 15CF374
--Case 15CM151, Count #1
--Case 15CM395, Counts #1 and #2
--Uncharged DA Case #15JE1961 DOV: 8/23/15 Charge: M-BJ
--Uncharged DA Case #15JE2275 DOV: 10/7-10/14/15 Charge: M-BJ

ADA Hall submits Victim Impact Statements
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Case 15CF374 Counts #3, #4, and #5, Case 15CM153 Count #1, and Case 15CM287 Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

--the Defendant shall undergo any mental health assessment as directed by DOC, and follow through with any recommended treatment as directed.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--The Defendant shall not be present in any bar, tavern, or liquor store
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--obtain High School Diploma/GED/HSED (whichever is the result of completing current educational program)
--to submit a DNA sample upon demand to designee
--the Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety
--no acts or threats of violence
--the Defendant shall take all prescribed medications as directed by her treating physicians
--to pay restitution to Shelly Hansen in the amount of $450
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--On Case 15CF375 Count #3: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Case 15CF375 Count #4: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Case 15CF375 Count #5: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Case 15CM153 Count #1: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Case 15CM287 Count #1: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

Parties are to submit a sentence credit stipulation in next 21 calendar days; if the stipulation has not been submitted for the Court's approval the case is to scheduled for credit hearing. 

The Court grants Ms. Hansen expungement upon successful completion of Probation
recess: 10:11am
Scheduling Notice

Cases 15CF374, 15CM151, 15CM153, and 15CM287 called  together at 9:09am [mo]
Defendant McKenzie A Hansen in court, in custody with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF374 (Waiver of Preliminary Hearing occurs):
Ms. Hansen waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--no demand for speedy trial

As to Cases 15CM151, 15CM153, and 15CM287 (State's Motion for Bond Modification):
--Atty. Rhiel verifies receipt of Motion
--Arguments given by Atty. Rhiel
--Arguments given by ADA Hall 
--The Court denies the State's Motion for Bond Modification; gives basis

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
recess: 9:34am

NEXT: AS TO CASE 15CF374:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 12/9/15 at 9:20am (2) Status Conference 1/11/16 at 10:00am
Motion hearing at 11-16-2015 08:30 am

Defendant McKenzie A Hansen in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Status conference at 10-20-2015 02:00 pm
CLERKS NOTE RE BOND
Defendant in custody//Duplicate Original Warrant returned by JCSD

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch II Intake
Cases 15CM151, 15CM153, and 15CM287 called together at 1:22pm. 
Defendant McKenzie A Hansen appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney John Rhiel.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

As to Case 15CM287(Initial Appearance occurs):
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Bond arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $200 CASH bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession of any financial transaction cards not in McKenzie Hansen's name or expressed consent of the owner 
--no discussion of the case with Troy or Shelly Hansen
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
--not to raise voice at parents home
--not to have physical contact with her mother
--Ms. Hansen will have a curfew of 11:00pm and will continue until 6:00am (Defendant is to be at home from the hours of 11:00pm to 6:00am, everyday)
--Ms. Hansen is to stay at the home of her mother or father, whoever will accept her, and the curfew applies wherever she is staying. 

Bond continues as previously set in Cases 15CM151 and 15CM153
recess: 1:37pm


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference: to be scheduled informally between Atty. Rhiel and DA's office   (2) Status Conference on 10/20/15 at 2:00pm

Cases 15CM151 and 15CM153 called together at 4:35pm [mo]
Attorney John Vernon Rhiel appears via telephone.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant, McKenzie Hansen does NOT appear.

The Court notes that it issued a warrant for Ms. Hansen at an earlier hearing on case 15CM287.
Due to Ms. Hansen's non appearance the Court issues a bench warrant in each case. Ms. Hansen may be released on posting $500 cash bail on EACH case and a new hearing date and time.
The Court clarifies that should Ms. Hansen be taken into custody, she will need to post $1,500 to be released and be given a new hearing date and time.
recess: 4:41pm
Status conference at 09-22-2015 03:30 pm
Status conference at 09-22-2015 09:40 am
Pre-trial conference at 09-09-2015 09:40 am

AMENDED - COVERING CASES 15CM151 & 15CM153

Cases 15CM151 & 15CM153 called together at 3:19 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant McKenzie A Hansen in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews petition for court appointed counsel which Miss Hansen filed with the Clerk of Courts earlier today
Court finds Miss Hansen indigent, grants petition for court appointed counsel & orders Atty John Rhiel to be appointed. Court orders that Miss Hansen reimburse the County at the rate of $200/month for Atty fees, beginning 7/23/15 no later than 4:00 pm and on the 23rd day of the month thereafter until further of the Court. No alternate set at this time. 
Court continues bond as previously set with further condition that Miss Hansen contact Atty Rhiel today via telephone
Recess: 3:27 pm 

NEXT: BOTH CASES: (1) Appoint Counsel (2) Reschedule Adjourned Initial Appearance 7/21/15 at 2:00 pm
